summary: Transit agencies and local governments have encouraged the development of mixed-use residential and commercial neighborhoods near bus or rail services to increase ridership and revenues. Local stakeholders and developers plan and build these "transit-oriented developments." In recent years, Congress and the U.S. Department of Transportation have tried to support such projects by making federal financing available. However, no such project has received federal financing. We...
title: Transit-Oriented Development: DOT Should Better Document Its Rationale for Financing Decisions and Evaluate Its Pilot Program
